content: That last night together was intense and emotional. We both knew that we would be separated for months and we didn't want to waste any time. We spent the evening talking, laughing, and sharing stories about our lives. We even danced together, which was something we had never done before. As the night wore on, our conversation became more serious and we both knew that we had feelings for each other. But we were both scared to express them, for fear of ruining the moment or making things awkward between us. So we didn't speak about our feelings, but instead just enjoyed each other's company and the time we had together. When it was time for me to leave, we hugged tightly and exchanged a few words of farewell, but again, we didn't speak about what was really in our hearts. It was bittersweet, but we both knew that we would see each other again soon and we held onto that hope.
